website_summaries.verdict: We appreciate this cutter's durable zinc alloy blade and its three snapping notches. Be prepared for a learning curve, however.
pros: Three notches for snapping thin, medium, or thick glass
Zinc alloy cutting blade maintains sharpness
cons: Proper pressure requires a learning curve

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to cut some small squares of glass to repair an outdoor lantern. Glass is pretty cheap, and I did ruin a few pieces. But after a little practice, you will find that this does the job. I did not use the round end at all. In fact, when I tapped with that I just cracked the glass. I found out that just putting on some good gloves, and bending the glass worked perfect. As far as pressure, that is where the practice comes in. But make only ONE pass, and not too hard. You will be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: EagleRock Dude

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little cutter. My wife loves it. She does mosaics with glass and it's working great for her.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Miller

customer_reviews.title: moved the cutter in the desired direction and you will easily scratch the glass
customer_reviews.text: This is a Classic design glass cutter. It is very to use and really works, but it takes a bit of practice. Just dip the cutter head into kerosene, press the cutter plate firmly onto the glass surface, moved the cutter in the desired direction and you will easily scratch the glass. Then turn the glass over and tap the glass with the ball on the other end of the cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C

customer_reviews.title: I...can....cut.....glass!!!
customer_reviews.text: This cool tool scores the glass so that you can break it off in a perfectly strait line. I recommend watching YouTube before trying it out. Be sure to were eye protection and work gloves, after all you’re working with glass. Make mirrors or windows any size you want!
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to make this work. It might be my own inexperience but it just would not even make a mark.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: This tool does what I needed it to do and it did not set me back cost wise. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Wilkey

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked fine for the first few uses then snapped in half.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to cut
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to make a cut. I have to repeated score the glass to make a cut.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a basic glass cutter
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Not sure how long the edge will last but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble initially using it but with some practice it seems to do the job. Be sure to use oil, it will help.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Arena

customer_reviews.title: Glass Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to get this cutter, It was super good service and.just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: now I just wish the glass would actually break where it's scored
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: I just think it needs to cut better in general
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but pressing hard is necessary to get any scoring done. The glass I was using might have been too thick for the cutter to cut deeply enough, so the project just didn't got done. I just think it needs to cut better in general.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Houck

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: does not work as well as my wife thought it would
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Laughner

customer_reviews.title: How do I use this?
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this isn't getting 5 stars is that there are absolutely no directions. I had no idea what I was doing. Besides that, everything else was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: StaceyM

product_meta.title: Goldblatt G05823 Glass Cutter
product_meta.description: The Gold blatt Glass Cutter is used for general cutting of glass. The ball end steel alloy wheel cuts clean and stays sharp for straight and curved cuts in glass and mirrors. The cutter is made of a zinc die cast metal.
feature_bullets: Made of Zinc Die Cast Metal
Use for General Cutting of Glass
Alloy wheel cuts clean and stays sharp
The ball end steel alloy wheel cuts clean and stays sharp for straight and curved cuts in glass and mirrors
